greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: The regular paper-folding (or dragon curve) sequence.
reference: G. Melancon, Factorizing infinite words using Maple, MapleTech journal, vol. 4, no. 1, 1997, pp. 34-42, esp. p. 36.
link: Ivan Panchenko, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10000
Index entries for sequences obtained by enumerating foldings
formula: Set a=2, b=1, S(0)=a, S(n+1) = S(n)aF(S(n)), where F(x) reverses x and then interchanges a and b; sequence is limit S(infinity).
mathematica: Nest[Append[#1, If[EvenQ[#2], 2 - BitAnd[1, #2/2], #1[[Ceiling[#2/2]]]]] & @@ {#, Length@ #} &, {2}, 105] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Apr 08 2021 *)
program: return 2-int(s[m-i-2]) if m-i-2 >= 0 else 2 # _Chai Wah Wu_, Apr 08 2021
xref: See A014577 for more references and more terms.
The following are all essentially the same sequence: A014577, A014707, A014709, A014710, A034947, A038189, A082410. - _N. J. A. Sloane_, Jul 27 2012
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_.
